Detailed Description

The CBinarySemaphore class wraps a native FreeRTOS binary semaphore handle (xSemaphoreHandle). To create a binary semaphore instance an object of this class and then call its CBinarySemaphore::Create method like showed in the following sample: 

 CBinarySemaphore g_aSemaphore // global semaphore declaration.

 void taskControlFunc(void *pParams) // a task control loop
 {
       g_aSemaphore.Create();

       for (;;) {
              while (g_aSemaphore.Take(portMAX_DELAY) != pdTRUE) {
              // do something
              }
 }
See also:
binary semaphore documentation in the FreeRTOS web site.
Date:
Jul 13, 2010
Author:

Definition at line 38 of file CBinarySemaphore.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CBinarySemaphore::CBinarySemaphore ( )

Default constructor. It initializes the object without attaching it to a native FreeRTOS handle. Call the Create method to allocate a binary semaphore handle and attach it to the object.

CBinarySemaphore.cpp

Created on: Jul 13, 2010 Author: Stefano Oliveri (STF12.net) E-Mail: software@stf12.net

CBinarySemaphore::CBinarySemaphore ( xSemaphoreHandle  handleSemaphore)

Create a binary semaphore instance and attach it to a valid handle.

Parameters:
handleSemaphorea valid binary semaphore handle.

CBinarySemaphore::~CBinarySemaphore ( ) [virtual]

Destructor. It deletes the native FreeRTOS counting semaphore.

Member Function Documentation

bool CBinarySemaphore::Create ( )

Create a FreeRTOS binary semaphore and attach its handle to the receiver object.

Returns:
true if the counting semaphore is created with success, false otherwise.
See also:
vSemaphoreCreateBinary FreeRTOS API function.
